009
010package imagingbook.common.color.adapt;
011
012import imagingbook.common.color.cie.Illuminant;
013import imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant;
014import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
015import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
016
017import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.inverse;
018import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.multiply;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class represents a linear chromatic adaptation transform, mapping XYZ color coordinates from a source white
023 * (reference) point to a target white point. Both white points are passed to the constructor. The actual color mapping
024 * is done by method {@link #applyTo(float[])}. The underlying linear transformation is specified by a 3x3 matrix, which
025 * may be retrieved by {@link #getAdaptationMatrix()}). See Sec. 14.6 of [1] for additional details and examples.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/11/14
034 * @see XYZscalingAdaptation
035 */
036public class BradfordAdaptation implements ChromaticAdaptation {
037        
038        // CAT forward transform matrix from XYZ to "virtual" RGB scaling coordinates
039        private static final double[][] MCAT = {
040            { 0.8951,  0.2664, -0.1614},
041            {-0.7502,  1.7135,  0.0367},
042            { 0.0389, -0.0685,  1.0296}};
043           
044        // CAT inverse transform matrix from "virtual" RGB scaling coordinates back to XYZ
045        private static final double[][] MCATi = inverse(MCAT);    // we always invert for precision reasons
046//              {{ 0.9869929054667120, -0.1470542564209900, 0.1599626516637310}, 
047//               { 0.4323052697233940,  0.5183602715367770, 0.0492912282128560}, 
048//               {-0.0085286645751770,  0.0400428216540850, 0.9684866957875500}}
049        
050        // the complete color adaptation transformation matrix for transforming source XYZ to target XYZ,
051        // XYZ2 = Madapt * XYZ1, with
052        // Madapt = MCAT^-1 * DiagRGB * MCAT
053        private final double[][] Madapt;
054        private final double[][] Mdiag;
055        
056        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
057
058        /**
059         * Returns a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance for the specified white point coordinates.
060         *
061         * @param W1 source white point (to map from)
062         * @param W2 target white point (to map to)
063         * @return a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance
064         */
065        public static BradfordAdaptation getInstance(double[] W1, double[] W2) {
066                return new BradfordAdaptation(W1, W2);
067        }
068
069        /**
070         * Returns a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance for the specified illuminants (white points).
071         *
072         * @param illum1 source illuminant (white point to map from)
073         * @param illum2 target illuminant (white point to map to)
074         * @return a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance
075         */
076        public static BradfordAdaptation getInstance(Illuminant illum1, Illuminant illum2) {
077                return getInstance(illum1.getXYZ(), illum2.getXYZ());
078        }
079        
080        /** Constructor (non-public) accepting two white points (XYZ-coordinates). */
081        private BradfordAdaptation(double[] W1, double[] W2) {
082                double[] rgb1 = multiply(MCAT, W1);
083                double[] rgb2 = multiply(MCAT, W2);
084                this.Mdiag = getRgbWhiteRatioMatrix(rgb1, rgb2);
085                this.Madapt = multiply(MCATi, multiply(Mdiag, MCAT));
086        }
087        
088        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
089        
090        public static double[][] getMCAT() {
091                return MCAT;
092        }
093        
094        public static double[][] getMCATi() {
095                return MCATi;
096        }
097        
098        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
099        
100        @Override
101        public float[] applyTo(float[] XYZA) {
102                // XYZB = Madapt . XYZA
103                float[] XYZB = new float[3];
104                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
105                        XYZB[i] = (float) (Madapt[i][0] * XYZA[0] + Madapt[i][1] * XYZA[1] + Madapt[i][2] * XYZA[2]);
106                }
107                return XYZB;
108        }
109        
110        @Override
111        public double[] applyTo(double[] XYZA) {
112                // XYZB = Madapt . XYZA
113                double[] XYZB = new double[3];
114                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
115                        XYZB[i] = Madapt[i][0] * XYZA[0] + Madapt[i][1] * XYZA[1] + Madapt[i][2] * XYZA[2];
116                }
117                return XYZB;
118        }
119
120        /**
121         * Returns the composite color adaptation transformation matrix.
122         *
123         * @return the color adaptation transformation matrix
124         */
125        public double[][] getAdaptationMatrix() {
126                return this.Madapt;
127        }
128        
129
130        // Creates a diagonal matrix with the ratios of the rgb components
131        // obtained by transforming the two white points
132        private static double[][] getRgbWhiteRatioMatrix(double[] rgbA, double[] rgbB) {
133                if (rgbA.length != rgbB.length) {
134                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
135                }
136                final int n = rgbA.length;
137                double[][] M = new double[n][n];
138                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
139                        M[i][i] = rgbB[i] / rgbA[i];
140                }
141                return M;
142        }
143
144        //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
145
146        public static void main(String[] args) {
147                PrintPrecision.set(9);
148                BradfordAdaptation a_65_50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D65, StandardIlluminant.D50);
149                System.out.println("M_65_50_diag = \n" + Matrix.toString(a_65_50.Mdiag));
150                System.out.println("M_65_50 = \n" + Matrix.toString(a_65_50.getAdaptationMatrix()));
151
152                BradfordAdaptation a_50_65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D50, StandardIlluminant.D65);
153                System.out.println("M_50_65_diag = \n" + Matrix.toString(a_50_65.Mdiag));
154                // System.out.println("M_50_65_diagI = \n" + Matrix.toString(Matrix.inverse(a_50_65.Mdiag)));
155                System.out.println("M_50_65 = \n" + Matrix.toString(a_50_65.getAdaptationMatrix()));
156
157                System.out.println("-----------------");
158
159                // converting ITU-R709 primaries to D50
160                System.out.println("D50 Red Primary = " + Matrix.toString(a_65_50.applyTo(0.64, 0.33)));
161                System.out.println("D50 Grn Primary = " + Matrix.toString(a_65_50.applyTo(0.30, 0.60)));
162                System.out.println("D50 Blu Primary = " + Matrix.toString(a_65_50.applyTo(0.15, 0.06)));
163        }
164                
165}
